message.content:
We must “extract” from the list only the sale‐ documents (their “type” is “Sale”) and then add up their “after_tax_amount” values to obtain the total revenue earned from ordinary (main business) operations. (Other entries – initial deposits, purchases, expenses, depreciation, interest items – are not revenue.) 

Below is one way to think through the process:

1. Identify each row whose “type” is “Sale”. In our table the rows with id beginning “Sale” have an “after_tax_amount” column that – for a finished sale transaction – represents the net sales amount.

2. We list each sale row together with its after‐tax amount:
  • Sale20240102001 after_tax_amount = 270019.43  
  • Sale20240102002 after_tax_amount = 261150.18  
  • Sale20240103004 after_tax_amount = 272670.62  
  • Sale20240106006 after_tax_amount = 171628.17  
  • Sale20240107008 after_tax_amount = 1939.65  
  • Sale20240108010 after_tax_amount = 271922.71 [Actually the row shows “285922.71” as the “amount” and then tax and net value are listed; according to the provided row the after_tax_amount is 271626.57]  
  • Sale20240110012 after_tax_amount = 1829.2  
  • Sale20240110013 after_tax_amount = 281066.82  
  • Sale20240111015 after_tax_amount = 2101.77  
  • Sale20240111016 after_tax_amount = 263422.59  
  • Sale20240111017 after_tax_amount = 183543.86  
  • Sale20240112018 after_tax_amount = 13071.17  
  • Sale20240123031 after_tax_amount = 2264.93  
  • Sale20240128037 after_tax_amount = 229196.46  
  • Sale20240128038 after_tax_amount = 251691.86  
  • Sale20240130040 after_tax_amount = 205584.96  
  • Sale20240130041 after_tax_amount = 258632.95  
  • Sale20240130042 after_tax_amount = 2197.43  
  • Sale20240131044 after_tax_amount = 229109.86  
  • Sale20240131045 after_tax_amount = 2143.01  
  • Sale20240204049 after_tax_amount = 11301.97  
  • Sale20240205052 after_tax_amount = 39451.51

3. Add them up step‐by‐step (it is always a good idea to check the addition carefully):

 – 270019.43  
 + 261150.18 = 531169.61  
 + 272670.62 = 803840.23  
 + 171628.17 = 975468.40  
 + 1939.65  = 977408.05  
 + 271626.57 = 1249034.62  
 + 1829.20  = 1250863.82  
 + 281066.82 = 1531930.64  
 + 2101.77  = 1534032.41  
 + 263422.59 = 1797455.00  
 + 183543.86 = 1980998.86  
 + 13071.17  = 1994070.03  
 + 2264.93  = 1996334.96  
 + 229196.46 = 2225531.42  
 + 251691.86 = 2477223.28  
 + 205584.96 = 2682808.24  
 + 258632.95 = 2941441.19  
 + 2197.43  = 2943638.62  
 + 229109.86 = 3172748.48  
 + 2143.01  = 3174891.49  
 + 11301.97  = 3186193.46  
 + 39451.51  = 3225644.97

Thus the total “after_tax_amount” from all Sale entries is 3,225,644.97. In the income statement the “Main Business Revenue” item would be set equal to that amount.

The final answer presented in the required json format is therefore:

{
  "solution": {
    "Main Business Revenue": "3225644.97"
  }
}
